markdownRemark.html:
Ingredients

Safeway

  • 1 pound fettuccine, cooked and well-drained
  • 2 tablespoons butter
  • 1.5 pounds Italian sausage
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped
  • 1 large green bell pepper, finely chopped
  • 1/2 cup sliced olives
  • 1/4 cup chopped mix of fresh parsely and basil
  • 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
  • 3 eggs, beaten
  • 4 tomatoes, thinly sliced
  • 1/2 cup grated Gruyere cheese
  • 1/2 cup grated mozzarella cheese
  • 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese

Cooking Equipment

  • 9" - 10" springform pan

Cooking Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 370Â°F.
  2. Toss hot fettuccine with butter in mixing bowl and cover.
  3. Remove sausage casings and finely chop meat.
  4. Brown sausage in heated olive oil; pour off fat. Add onions and bell pepper; cook 5 minutes.
  5. Combine sausage mixture, olives, parsely-basil mix, pepper, and noodles. Stir in eggs and toss to combine well.
  6. Lightly flour and butter a springform pan.
  7. Press half the pasta mixture in the bottom; layer half the tomatoes on the pasta.
  8. Sprinkle the mozzarella and Gruyere over the tomatoes. Repeat the layers.
  9. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the top.
  10. Cover with foil and bake 50 minutes until set.
  11. To serve, slice into wedges.

frontmatter.title: Sausage Fettuccine Torte
frontmatter.description: This post is related to the gatsbyjs
frontmatter.recipeIntroParagraph: This recipe was given to me by my uncle Dwight. I'll pretty much eat anything with pasta, but this dish became a favorite with the addition of Italian sausage and veggies. It was cool to take the torta out of the oven, open the springform pan, and see everything had formed to the shape of a pie. I even served the dish like a pie. Really cool, and left me with lots of leftovers.
frontmatter.sourceWebsite: Emilie A. Morse (Pure and Simple - Neiman Marcus)
